TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ComponentEditor extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides the base class for a custom component editor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A component editor is used to edit a component as a whole and can be used to implement a user interface similar to that of the property pages. You associate a component editor with a component by using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> attribute.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates an example <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor> implementation.
[!code-cpp[ComponentEditorExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/CPP/componenteditorexamplecomponent.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ComponentEditorExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/CS/componenteditorexamplecomponent.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ComponentEditorExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/VB/componenteditorexamplecomponent.vb#1)]

block.para: When you inherit from this class, you must override the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool EditComponent(object component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Edits the component and returns a value indicating whether the component was modified.
Docs.returns: if the component was modified; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method opens an advanced user interface that you can use to edit the component. The default implementation opens a dialog box with a collection of component editor control objects and a user interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool EditComponent (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object component);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool EditComponent(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object component) cil managed

Docs.param: An optional context object that can be used to obtain further information about the edit.
Docs.summary: Edits the component and returns a value indicating whether the component was modified based upon a given context.
Docs.returns: if the component was modified; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can override this method to provide a custom editing user interface for a component. From within this method you can display a dialog box or other type of user interface.
